SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - JUNE 2nd, 1918.
The enemy is reported to have attacked with 5 divisions in the neighbourhood of VRIGNY (South-west of RHEIMS) and was completely repulsed.
Heavy fighting has been going on all day East of the VILLERS - COTTERET forest. Details are not yet available but the Germans appear to have gained little ground.
Between SOISSONS and NOYON only artillery activity is reported.
The line remains practically the same as in this morning's statement, except South of CHEZY, where line runs VEUILLY LA POTERIE - North-east corner of BOIS DE VEUILLY - TORCY - BOURESCHES (German) East of LAMARETTE wood - CROGIS - GENETTE FARM - CHARLY SUR MARNE.
The portion of CHATEAU THIERRY North of the MARNE is in German hands and the bridges over the MARNE have been destroyed.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
Issued at 6.50 p.m.
For the personal information - of the Minister only. -
